item.author: 作者

item.title: 04-名词解释和回答问题
item.author: 作者
item.description: Explanation of Terms 名词解释 ASCII 美国信息交换标准代码 ASCII, abbreviated from American Standard Code for Information Interchange, is a character encoding standard for electronic communication. ASCII codes represent text in computers, telecommunications equipment, and other devices. Most modern character-encoding schemes are based on ASCII, although they support many additional characters. item.title: 03-判断溢出和精度误差和名词解释
item.author: 作者
item.description: 判断溢出错误和精度误差 Write out variables x, y and z in binary code int8_t x = 67; int8_t y = -7; int8_t z = y - x; int8_t x = 0xd3; uint8_t = 0xd3; int8_t x = 127; int8_t y = -7; int8_t z = y – x; float x = 1.125; float x = 23.0; float x = 0.45; Specifier Equivalent
